title: Battle of Nineveh: A Byzantine army under Emperor Heraclius defeats Emperor Khosrau II's Persian forces, commanded by General Rhahzadh.
text: • 627 – Battle of Nineveh: A Byzantine army under Emperor Heraclius defeats Emperor Khosrau II's Persian forces, commanded by General Rhahzadh.

title: King Carloman II dies after a hunting accident. He is succeeded by his cousin, emperor Charles the Fat, who for the last time reunites the Frankish Empire.
text: • 884 – King Carloman II dies after a hunting accident. He is succeeded by his cousin, emperor Charles the Fat, who for the last time reunites the Frankish Empire.

title: First Crusade: Siege of Ma'arrat al
text: • 1098 – First Crusade: Siege of Ma'arrat al-Numan: Crusaders breach the town's walls and massacre about 20,000 inhabitants. After finding themselves with insufficient food, they reportedly resort to cannibalism.

title: Mary of Enghien sells the lordship of Argos and Nauplia to the Republic of Venice.
text: • 1388 – Mary of Enghien sells the lordship of Argos and Nauplia to the Republic of Venice.

title: The Order of the Dragon, a monarchical chivalric order, is created by Sigismund of Luxembourg, then king of Hungary.
text: • 1408 – The Order of the Dragon, a monarchical chivalric order, is created by Sigismund of Luxembourg, then king of Hungary.

title: American Revolutionary War: Second Battle of Ushant: A British fleet led by HMS Victory defeats a French fleet.
text: • 1781 – American Revolutionary War: Second Battle of Ushant: A British fleet led by HMS Victory defeats a French fleet.

title: Pennsylvania becomes the second state to ratify the United States Constitution, five days after Delaware became the first.
text: • 1787 – Pennsylvania becomes the second state to ratify the United States Constitution, five days after Delaware became the first.

title: American Civil War: USS Cairo sinks on the Yazoo River, becoming the first armored ship to be sunk by a controlled mine.
text: • 1862 – American Civil War: USS Cairo sinks on the Yazoo River, becoming the first armored ship to be sunk by a controlled mine.

title: Oaks explosion: The worst mining disaster in England kills 361 miners and rescuers.
text: • 1866 – Oaks explosion: The worst mining disaster in England kills 361 miners and rescuers.

title: Joseph H. Rainey of South Carolina becomes the second black U.S. congressman, the first being Hiram Revels.
text: • 1870 – Joseph H. Rainey of South Carolina becomes the second black U.S. congressman, the first being Hiram Revels.

title: Belo Horizonte, the first planned city in Brazil, is founded.
text: • 1897 – Belo Horizonte, the first planned city in Brazil, is founded.

title: Guglielmo Marconi receives the first transatlantic radio signal (the letter "S" [***] in Morse Code), at Signal Hill in St John's, Newfoundland.
text: • 1901 – Guglielmo Marconi receives the first transatlantic radio signal (the letter "S" [***] in Morse Code), at Signal Hill in St John's, Newfoundland.

title: Delhi replaces Calcutta as the capital of India.
text: • 1911 – Delhi replaces Calcutta as the capital of India.

title: King George V of the United Kingdom and Mary of Teck are enthroned as Emperor and Empress of India.
text: • 1911 – King George V of the United Kingdom and Mary of Teck are enthroned as Emperor and Empress of India.

title: President of the Republic of China, Yuan Shikai, announces his intention to reinstate the monarchy and proclaim himself Emperor of China.
text: • 1915 – President of the Republic of China, Yuan Shikai, announces his intention to reinstate the monarchy and proclaim himself Emperor of China.

title: In Nebraska, Father Edward J. Flanagan founds Boys Town as a farm village for wayward boys.
text: • 1917 – In Nebraska, Father Edward J. Flanagan founds Boys Town as a farm village for wayward boys.

title: The Flag of Estonia is raised atop the Pikk Hermann for the first time.
text: • 1918 – The Flag of Estonia is raised atop the Pikk Hermann for the first time.

title: The Majlis of Iran votes to crown Reza Khan as the new Shah of Iran, starting the Pahlavi dynasty.
text: • 1925 – The Majlis of Iran votes to crown Reza Khan as the new Shah of Iran, starting the Pahlavi dynasty.

title: Lebensborn Project, a Nazi reproduction program, is founded by Heinrich Himmler.
text: • 1935 – Lebensborn Project, a Nazi reproduction program, is founded by Heinrich Himmler.

title: Xi'an Incident: The Generalissimo of the Republic of China, Chiang Kai
text: • 1936 – Xi'an Incident: The Generalissimo of the Republic of China, Chiang Kai-shek, is kidnapped by Zhang Xueliang.

title: Second Sino
text: • 1937 – Second Sino-Japanese War: USS Panay incident: Japanese aircraft bomb and sink U.S. gunboat USS Panay on the Yangtze river in China.

title: Winter War: Battle of Tolvajärvi: Finnish forces defeat those of the Soviet Union in their first major victory of the conflict.
text: • 1939 – Winter War: Battle of Tolvajärvi: Finnish forces defeat those of the Soviet Union in their first major victory of the conflict.

title: HMS Duchess sinks after a collision with HMS Barham off the coast of Scotland with the loss of 124 men.
text: • 1939 – HMS Duchess sinks after a collision with HMS Barham off the coast of Scotland with the loss of 124 men.

title: World War II: Approximately 70 people are killed in the Marples Hotel, Fitzalan Square, Sheffield, as a result of a German air raid.
text: • 1940 – World War II: Approximately 70 people are killed in the Marples Hotel, Fitzalan Square, Sheffield, as a result of a German air raid.

title: World War II: Fifty
text: • 1941 – World War II: Fifty-four Japanese A6M Zero fighters raid Batangas Field, Philippines. Jesús Villamor and four Filipino fighter pilots fend them off; César Basa is killed.

title: World War II: The United Kingdom declares war on Bulgaria. Hungary and Romania declare war on the United States. India declares war on Japan.
text: • 1941 – World War II: The United Kingdom declares war on Bulgaria. Hungary and Romania declare war on the United States. India declares war on Japan.

title: Adolf Hitler declares the imminent extermination of the Jews at a meeting in the Reich Chancellery
text: • 1941 – Adolf Hitler declares the imminent extermination of the Jews at a meeting in the Reich Chancellery

title: World War II: German troops begin Operation Winter Storm, an attempt to relieve encircled Axis forces during the Battle of Stalingrad.
text: • 1942 – World War II: German troops begin Operation Winter Storm, an attempt to relieve encircled Axis forces during the Battle of Stalingrad.

title: A fire at an ice plant in Hudson Heights, Manhattan spreads to an adjacent tenement, killing 37 people.
text: • 1946 – A fire at an ice plant in Hudson Heights, Manhattan spreads to an adjacent tenement, killing 37 people.

title: United Nations Security Council Resolution 13 relating to acceptance of Siam to United Nations is adopted.
text: • 1946 – United Nations Security Council Resolution 13 relating to acceptance of Siam to United Nations is adopted.

title: Malayan Emergency: Batang Kali massacre: Fourteen members of the Scots Guards stationed in Malaya allegedly massacre 24 unarmed civilians and set fire to the village.
text: • 1948 – Malayan Emergency: Batang Kali massacre: Fourteen members of the Scots Guards stationed in Malaya allegedly massacre 24 unarmed civilians and set fire to the village.

title: Paula Ackerman, the first woman appointed to perform rabbinical functions in the United States, leads the congregation in her first services.
text: • 1950 – Paula Ackerman, the first woman appointed to perform rabbinical functions in the United States, leads the congregation in her first services.

title: Beginning of the Irish Republican Army's "Border Campaign".
text: • 1956 – Beginning of the Irish Republican Army's "Border Campaign".

title: United Nations Security Council Resolution 121 relating to acceptace of Japan to United Nations is adopted.
text: • 1956 – United Nations Security Council Resolution 121 relating to acceptace of Japan to United Nations is adopted.

title: Kenya gains its independence from the United Kingdom.
text: • 1963 – Kenya gains its independence from the United Kingdom.

title: Prime Minister Jomo Kenyatta becomes the first President of the Republic of Kenya.
text: • 1964 – Prime Minister Jomo Kenyatta becomes the first President of the Republic of Kenya.

title: Years of Lead: Piazza Fontana bombing: The offices of Banca Nazionale dell'Agricoltura in Piazza Fontana, Milan, are bombed.
text: • 1969 – Years of Lead: Piazza Fontana bombing: The offices of Banca Nazionale dell'Agricoltura in Piazza Fontana, Milan, are bombed.

title: Coup d'état of December Twelfth: South Korean Army Major General Chun Doo
text: • 1979 – Coup d'état of December Twelfth: South Korean Army Major General Chun Doo-hwan orders the arrest of Army Chief of Staff General Jeong Seung-hwa without authorization from President Choi Kyu-ha, alleging involvement in the assassination of ex-President Park Chung-hee.

title: President of Pakistan Muhammad Zia
text: • 1979 – President of Pakistan Muhammad Zia-ul-Haq confers Nishan-e-Imtiaz on Nobel laureate Dr Abdus Salam.

title: The unrecognised state of Zimbabwe
text: • 1979 – The unrecognised state of Zimbabwe-Rhodesia returns to British control and resumes using the name Southern Rhodesia.

title: The 8.2 Mw Tumaco earthquake shakes Colombia and Ecuador with a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent), killing 300
text: • 1979 – The 8.2 Mw Tumaco earthquake shakes Colombia and Ecuador with a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent), killing 300–600, and generating a large tsunami.

title: The Australian Labor government led by Prime Minister Bob Hawke and Treasurer Paul Keating floats the Australian dollar.
text: • 1983 – The Australian Labor government led by Prime Minister Bob Hawke and Treasurer Paul Keating floats the Australian dollar.

title: Maaouya Ould Sid'Ahmed Taya becomes the third president of Mauritania after a coup d'état against Mohamed Khouna Ould Haidalla while the latter is attending a summit.
text: • 1984 – Maaouya Ould Sid'Ahmed Taya becomes the third president of Mauritania after a coup d'état against Mohamed Khouna Ould Haidalla while the latter is attending a summit.

title: Arrow Air Flight 1285, a McDonnell Douglas DC
text: • 1985 – Arrow Air Flight 1285, a McDonnell Douglas DC-8, crashes after takeoff in Gander, Newfoundland, killing all 256 people on board, including 236 members of the United States Army's 101st Airborne Division.

title: The Clapham Junction rail crash kills thirty
text: • 1988 – The Clapham Junction rail crash kills thirty-five and injures hundreds after two collisions of three commuter trains—one of the worst train crashes in the United Kingdom.

title: The Russian Federation gains independence from the USSR.
text: • 1991 – The Russian Federation gains independence from the USSR.

title: The United States Supreme Court releases its decision in Bush v. Gore.
text: • 2000 – The United States Supreme Court releases its decision in Bush v. Gore.

title: Prime Minister of Vietnam Phan Văn Khải announces the decision on upgrading the Phong Nha
text: • 2001 – Prime Minister of Vietnam Phan Văn Khải announces the decision on upgrading the Phong Nha–Kẻ Bàng nature reserve to a national park, providing information on projects for the conservation and development of the park and revised maps.

title: North Korea successfully launches its first satellite, Kwangmyŏngsŏng
text: • 2012 – North Korea successfully launches its first satellite, Kwangmyŏngsŏng-3 Unit 2, using an Unha-3 carrier rocket.

title: Paris Agreement relating to United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change is adopted.
text: • 2015 – Paris Agreement relating to United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change is adopted.

title: Doug Jones wins the 2017 US Senate special election in Alabama, becoming the first Democrat to win a Senate seat in Alabama since 1992.
text: • 2017 – Doug Jones wins the 2017 US Senate special election in Alabama, becoming the first Democrat to win a Senate seat in Alabama since 1992.
